name: Camping Trsteno
description: Beautiful terrain under olive trees between Dubrovnik and Split

name: Camping Krvavica
description: Very full terrain. Not big camp. A lot of shade

name: Camping Cvetovic
description: Open terrain, cosy meeting room.

name: Camp Zagreb
description: Located on a small lake just outside of Zagreb. They provide a shuttle into the city. Proper caravan park, and well designed. European prices. Very nice bathrooms and showers, washing machine and dishwashing station. No shade. 35 USD for caravan and 2 people.

name: Auto camp Paradiso/Laguna
description:
Very nice terraced campground with lots of shade provided by olive trees. Access to a small beach, showers, wifi. 
About 17 EUR for two people, a car and a tent. 45 kuna per person + 30 for a car with roof tent, in July and August. 
Access road is narrow and steep, could be an issue for trailers/big rigs. Also very little maneuvering space.
Lots of mosquitoes at night (August)

name: Kupari Resort
description:
An abandoned complex of 4 hotels next to Dubrovnik. By the beach.Public toilets are open during the day 
Fresh water shower on beach.

name: Camping Plitvice Zagreb
description: Old place and OK for transit otherwise do not go here. Off season we could shower in a room. Payed 150 KN per night for camping.

name: Grožnjan - Beautiful Town
description: Grožnjan is a really nice old mountain town you should visit if you are close!

name: Small Ruin Of Old Hotel With Place For A Camper
description: It's a old ruin of a hotel!? In the back is a place, with view over the ocean, where you could stay for a night! You have to decide if it's save for you...

name: Wild camping with the the perfect view
description: Go down the street from Šišan towards the beach! It's a dirt road with a lot of holes. Just follow it and when you are close to the beach find your spot, there are many perfect places! Back to the nature! I bet you'll love it...

name: Camp Marta
description: Camp Marta is a small cosy camping just 1.5 km away from the beach! It's cheap and Marta, the owner is a super lovely person. Everything is clean and you have fresh water, bathrooms and a place to wash dishes, as well as a laundry. Little shops are close by.

name: Camp Bunica I
description: A small campground right in front of a little bay! Very cosy and the price is good! Fresh water, shower, toilets and a place to wash your dishes...

name: The Perfect View
description: Check out this place if you pass by! You will not regret it... ;)

name: Autocamp Rozac
description: A big campground just 20 minutes walk from the old centre of trogir! It has a beautiful beach right at the campground and a restaurant available! Beach bars are just 5 minutes walk away...

name: Camp Ciste
description: Great little campsite with its own beach. On site restaurant. Clean toilet/shower block. Shady terranced camp spots. Not brillant for pitching tents because of stoney ground, but can be done. Wifi is good but only at reception.

name: Camping Split
description:
Nice campsite with all facilities and a couple of nice swim beaches. 23 euro 1 person, tent and car.
There is a easy bus to catch straight to the old city. 13kn cash each way per adult.

name: Overnight Stop
description: Handy flat gravel track, good for overnight stop if you sleep in your vehicle. The ground is to stoney to pitch tents. Easy access for two wheel drives or big rigs. Sea and mountain views.

name: Free Wifi
description: Free wifi in square provided by city. .... ....

name: Autokamp Zalo
description: Nice little private campground on the beach. Extremely clean facilities (there is a lady standing in front of the toilet/shower block cleaning after every 'client'). Cost: 20 € for 2 and a van. The coast highway is next to the campground so it can get a loud at night.

name: A Place For Campers In The Heart Of Town
description: It's just a place for campers to stay in the heart of town, just found it at night!

name: Kite Spot Neretva
description: It's actually a kite spot. But here is a lot of space for camping and there are a lot of people doing so! So enjoy your time watching kiters or take a lesson!

name: Ponta Camping
description: teeny tiny place but perfect spot if you kite or windsurf since you can walk across the street and launch. nice resto & bar which may be why they are the most relaxed about the camping side of their business. If you want bigger more european style camping there are about 10 other places within 2km stretch so you can shop around first. if you are into wind sports there is second point 2km east with camping but was more crowded and they say wind a little better here

name: Autocamp Pisak Seline
description: Nice little campground next to the beach. Very clean facilities. Restaurant and shops nearby. Very quiet at night. Friendly owner. Cost: 20€ / 2 and a van.

name: Camp Marina
description: Shady campground. Great for booking a trip to the beautiful Krka NP. Can be noisy due to traffic passing by...

name: Solitudo
description: Big campsite, lots of shady places, very close to city center. Busstation around the corner. 5 min. walk to the beach. Tent, car, 2 pers. 45€ very expensive for what you get.....

name: Kamp Nevio
description: Big terraced camping with lots of shady spots next to the beach.... Price range from 10€ - 25€. No free WIFI

name: Autocamp Tabor
description: Brand new campsite near the beach and a harbour. Perfect spot!! Tent, car, 2 pers. €26. Free WIFI. Not much shade, because just opened... 😊.

name: Istralandia- Free Wifi + Toilets In Car park
description: can get on the free wifi from the car park. Also toilets, ATM and money exchange

name: Wild Camping with terraces
description: At the end it is possible to camp at the coast side between Svetica and Kavran (although there are signs that camping is forbidden.- okay maybe no one is checking it but we where undisturbed for one night.) We randomly decided for that place and it was perfect. The whole coast line is a camping mekka for locals and guests. For big rigs- maybe be the trees are disturbing.

name: Parking space Lubenice
description: We parked for one night at the parking space in front of Lubenice. If you drive the small roads up to Lubenice you have to pay 15 KN for parking (one day), after that we visited the 15th best beaches of the world (hiking trail up to 40', you need proper shoes!) in the evening we ate at a beautiful restaurant in the town centre. after that having a vine on our camp ground and a safe night. enjoy! p.s.: if you buy a glas of honey from the old lady you have a friend in Lubenice.

name: Fishermens Friend
description: It's a small harbour behind a hilly road; after asking a boats owner we stayed one night.

name: Lonesome Fox
description: After you took a curvy road down to an old stone mill you can decide if you wanna have the awsome view on the bridge between Island Krk and Rijeka or you wanna stay on a small more silent beach. We decided for the bridge one, the only neighbours are stone builders which start to work very early. It is a perfect ground to stay more then a day and maybe the lonesome fox will visit you at your first barbecue. If you stay on the other side there are left buildings from the old stone mill, !!!be aware there are open cable tunnels and canal system entries!!!

name: Harbour with no noise right on the Adriatic
description: Get down from the main road 8/E65 and drive through an open barrier down the old road to the small harbour. Local fisherman are there in the evening hours and some wild dogs may visit you. In the morning we saw two dolphins near the harbour.

name: Auto Camp Sirena
description: Very clean facilities, wonderful restaurant and staff, tiered camping right on the cliff whole way down to the water. 220 kuna for two adults, tent camping with kid. In high season, we came with no reservation and they found three possible spots for our tent. Electric available at site with Long extension, noticed people used communal refrigerators and the restaurant lets you use their open grill for free.

name: Coast Camp
description:
A very common place for bathing tourist and campers directly at the coast. Plenty of space around. 
Beautiful view on the see, little bit romantic at the evening with the sunset.

name: Alex Free Camp
description: A small private camp ground. Close to the road, but in the woods. You can stay free or give the owner a donation. There are some fireplaces.

name: Grabovača Parking
description:
We met the park ranger in early evening and he said that the park is closed for today but we can sleep there and visit it tomorrow. So we did. 
A level, big gravel parking lot. Nice view an absolutely quiet. When the entrance is open there is a toilet. 
Water is available also when closed.

name: Olive Grove
description: A few quiet roadside places to stop around here.  It's next to the road but no passing traffic when we camped in early March.  Amazing sunsets and views.

name: Camping Ferry Bay
description: Nice campground under trees next to small bay and close to ferry dock. Was still closed in march but there was free parking right in front.

name: Wild Camping
description: Nice Place near The Beach . Dirty Road

name: Wild Camping Im Wald
description:
Nothing in the area. 3 km into the forest then a large clearing on the right 

Nichts in der Gegend. 3 km in den Wald fahren dann eine grose Lichtung rechts

name: Odmoree
description: All pitches have sea views. Only 13 pitches available. Full hook up, wifi, laundry facilities, kitchen. Modern and clean bathroom facilities. Modern amenities- power, drainage, water hook up. Pool and bar. Cabins and hostel also available.

name: Igor
description: Small beautiful campsite, situated by the sea. Open all year. Very friendly people.

name: Autocamp Skradin-Skorici
description: Free wifi, good amenities, quiet small campground, laundry. Nice owner

name: Kamp Slapic
description: Great campsite next to the beautiful river. Pitches for caravans and campers or space between the trees on the meadow on the banks of the river. Great swimming in a beautiful river or Kayak rental. Good restaurant onsite and very helpful reception !

name: Flat field next to the river
description: A nice spot, just off the main road next to the river. Not sure if this is an informal camping site or private property, tables are available and a small shelter. Steep access road.

name: Small harbour
description:
Small Harbour/rock beach with a small parking space. We met some official firemen and they told us we could stay!
No fires allowed. 
Great place off season, not recomended during high season.

Place is graveled, may not be the best choice for tents

name: Kamp Seget
description: Nice friendly sight, clean facilities but gets very busy in July August.

name: Camp Krka
description:
Friendly site, we arrived early so had a choice of pitches. 
Later very busy so choices limited.
Not a huge amount of shade.
Has a small swimming pool great to cool down.
Has a washing machine.

name: Camp Korana
description:
Very big and very busy if you arrive late but can take up to 2000 people and don't take bookings.
Very modern and clean facilities,
Wifi a bit slow as camp fills up but being here in August we could not expect it to be quiet.
Free bus to NP at 0900 and return 1700 hrs.
Washing machines available in the ladies restroom 40 kuna per wash.
Little bit expensive about 220 kuna for 2 adults with car and camping trailer, electricity included

name: Campground at beach
description: Car parking near beach. Room for camper and big rigs. Parking 0900-2100 is 30 kuna. We arrived 2030 and were not charged anything. Adjacent restaurant and toilet.

name: Camping Opatija
description:
Run down and not greatly maintained.
A very big tree branch fell as we set up narrowly missing a caravan and pulling the electricity pole over.nothing like the website pictures, much more run down and the most expensive site we stayed at in Croatia at 220 kuna a night.
Sadly the site does not do just to its location at Opatija which is lovely.
Said it had a restaurant but we never saw it.
Cleaning carried out multiple times a day but the reception staff were miserable as sin and asking questions seemed to just annoy them.
If we had not been visiting friends we would not have stayed here

name: Spot besides salty lake.
description: Its a very good Place to have a nigtht there. We stand Alpen here. The water ist Not so Deep so iTunes Not perfectly to swim. Ehen you Go 100meters everything is ok!

name: Sea View
description:
Directly on the road 20 meters to the sea 

Dreamwater water Nixe place and surprice gor Go away!

name: Sea view
description: Wonderful Place to sleep an swim and Picknick under The tree

name: camping ori
description: nice small camping with room dir 10 tents. private owned, 4 persons, 2 tents, 3 bikes 35€ per night..More @..www.RTWbyBIKE.com

name: Camping Kate
description: Nice camping area, access to beach, safe, clean showers. Paid 116 kuna (cash)  for 2 person, tent and a moto

name: Autocamp Navis
description: A very new, beautiful, small campground with a lot of places directly on the beach/sea. very clean and well maintained. for us the nicest and best campground along the croatia coastline.

name: Picnic Area
description: Nice picnic spot in an olive garden provided by the government. Flat spots for several cars and view of the ocean. little traffic.

name: Wooded beach side
description: Just off the main road. Quiet beach side visited by locals on weekends. Beautiful spot.

name: Small stony beach between cliffs
description: Beautiful place for wild camping. The last part of the gravel road down requires 4wd and is a bit rough. Pretty isolated.

name: Camping Lolo
description: Sweet, cheap little campsite with space for tents and a few caravans, right near loads of restaurants on the sea.

name: Odmoriste Vrata Jadrana
description: Seasight, relatively quiet, WC, free WIFI, snack, shop, all carburants.

name: Slatine
description: it is 10 minutes from Slatine, it is at the end of the road a small car park very quiet, after you can still walk 10 minutes to see a small chapel and 10 more to be at the seaside. beautiful place !!! path in pebbles and gravel !!! not suitable for large motorhome

name: bear camp
description: small camping (40) hot shower washmachine, on top of small hill. green grass. 130kuna for 2+motorhome. restaurant and small market 500m. in front of korona camping

name: Njivice camping resort
description: Nice big pitches, aparently not too busy in off-season.  Excellent in- or outdoor showers, ACSI card accepted.  Perfect for a one night stopover with everything you need closeby.  Nice views, lots of little concrete or pebble beaches around!

name: Camp Stine
description:
Small but very nice camp directly by the sea. 
Camping pitches on different levels, most in the shade of olive and pine trees. Ability to swim, small bar, picnic tables, free wifi, clean facilities, washing machine. Very friendly owner and fair prices (about 15€ for 2 with camper). Only downside: it‘s close to the coastal road.

name: Hodilje View
description:
Nice place directly by the sea with a beautiful view. Close to the coastal road but well hidden from it. A small road runs down, last 50m gravel and almost level. 
A bit trash laying around, but a good stop for one night on the way from/to Dubrovnik.

name: Bathing in the river spring jungle
description:
Nice wild camp location at a river. There is a waterfall nearby and a spot where you can go into the clear water.
There are some more good spots for camping along the road to this place.

name: Grasy area with ocean view
description: Nice big grasy area, a bit away from the road, hidden, no facilities, ocean view, no shade, no possibility to walk to the ocean

name: Lonesome Beaches
description: Along the Coastline there are some spots where you can enjoy the beach without other people. It seems that they stick to the campsite beaches. This spot ist small but there are bigger ones If you go east

name: Grasshopper and herbs overnight stay
description: big flat area, lonesome at night except some sheeps. Lots of Grasshoppers for the dogs to play

name: Lubenice Beach
description: Wonderful beach with less people. You can reach it by boat or by walking a 1h trail down. Take a lot of water with you, there is no much shade on the beach. Consider going down early and hiking up late, because the trail is exposed to the sun.

name: Camping Slamni
description:
Small but very nice campground. About 45 pitches. Direct acces to the beach. may be private beach. With beach bar and small pool for children. Whirl pool also for adults. Very good restaurant.
The pitches are graveled, may not be ideal for tents.

name: between the scrubs
description: Not the nicest place, since there is a lot of garbage around, but hidden from the road, if you drive the little entrance a little to the back.

name: Camping Slapič
description: Large campsite on a clean river with swimming areas. Discount with ACSI card. Modern sanitary. Subsoil: fortified meadow and gravel. Partial shadows through trees. Wifi is fast and free.

name: Lakeshore camp
description: nice little flat place, next to the lake at end of little dirtroad. Some trees,; windy, quiet.

name: flat place near hill top
description:
it's the parking at the end of the tiny  dead-end road. Don't think anybody will disturb you here. Can get windy. One picknick table available. 
It's also starting point of some hikes to the national park. 
Narrow, steep mountain road.

name: Camping Belvedere
description: Big Campground with about 500 pitches all on terraces. Most of the pitches have sea view. Very clean and mostly shady. A little expensive, but realy higher level.

name: Camp Milo Moje
description: Brand new campsite openend June 2018. Little campsite with about 30 pitches all on diffrent levels. All pitches with sea view. Very friendly staff. The boss gave 20% discount because we were the first German guests.

name: Eco camp Rizvan City
description:
Offers a different view of Croatia. The landscape is nice and the atmosphere relaxing. It is part of an adventure park that offeres something for everyone. You can do very nice bike rides, motorcycle rides and trail running here. It cost us 20€/night. 2 persons, 2 motorcycles and one small tent.
Update: When we drove off from the camp my wife got her front tire punctured by a screw from the construction site on the camp. Beware of such hazards.

name: Camping Prapratno
description: Big Campground with direct acces to a very nice, nearly sandy beach. Place with lot of shade from big trees.

name: Autocamp Sime
description: Big flat area in an urban setting with olive trees where there's place for 10 camping cars. Super friendly host with new toilet shower bloc

name: Auto Camp Kupari
description: An interesting place 7 Km further south from Dubrovnik. It looks deserted but it is clean. Dubrovnik is easily accessible by bus nr. 10.

name: Border crossing closed
description: This border is closed to international traveler. don’t cross here!!!!

name: Abandoned Barack and radar! Very hard off road
description: Right on top there is an abandoned military Barack and radar. You get a brilliant view of both Croatia and Bosnia as you will be right on the border point. Road is ok for 3/4 of the way but then become hard when get close the pick with baseball sized stones and gravels. We did it on tow fully loaded bmw gsa, so any other adventure bikes should be able to do it.

name: Above Starigrad
description:
Nice viewpoint parking high above Starigrad. Access through narrow streets of the town before the road starts a steep ascend. There is another similar parking 500m down the road.

Picknick table and benches available.
Can get busy during summer season.

name: Kamp Maslinik
description: Small family camp with a lot of shops de from olives and figs. Not directly to the beach but just a 5 minute walk to the center of Punat and beaches.

name: Kazela campsite
description: Campsite next to the beach. Clean and some shade. I ended up here because I didn't found a spot for wild camping. The site is big, the prices also

name: Dubrovnik PLIN
description:
This place was able to fill our South African gas canister - they had adapters to put 3 kg of gas into our 5kg tank. This was the first place we found that could fill our tank since we arrived to Greece from Egypt. 

Weekdays 7-21
Sat 7-15
Sun closed

name: Jadranska Magistrala
description: Right next to the old main road along the coast. Nice view out to the sea. Not much traffic, hardly any once the sun has set … and as it is far away from any urban area quite unlikely some authorities chase you away.

name: Harbor Marina Veruda
description: Opposite number 18 in the harbour is a gas filling station. Campingaz 907 cilinder filling price 42kuna.

name: Funtana
description: Karlos is a wonderful elektricien who works with his son from a garage at the address Grgeti 2, Funtana. They are elektriciens specialized in working at boats and campers. Aso he has very good contacts with other car companies in the area and is well known. Very friendly and helpful.

name: Raša
description: Fantastic View all along the Coast Side on Top of a Hill. Quiet for one night, not for a long stay. right at the entrance of a small village. A small Parking lot next to Road uphill with lot of wild herbs. You have a beautiful sunset.

name: Grassy patch
description: Small grassy patch at the end of the road up the mountain. No signs saying no camping but we all know how Croatia is. cars or small campers only, definitely not for motorhomes due to difficult drive up

name: Camp Terre
description: Very nice, clean, quite. Friendly Host. Sells his own wine and Olive oil. 125kn first night. Every following night100kn. Including electricity and WiFi

name: MV Start
description: MV Start is a company that sources parts for all American and 4x4 vehicles in Croatia.  If you need the part they can get it.  They also do mechanical work or can direct you to the best mechanic who can.  Vladimir and his wife Andrea worked extremely hard to find a tie rod for my JK Jeep Wrangler that I could pick up same day in Zagreb.

name: Picnic spot along the Lika
description:
Picnic spot along the Lika river. Picnic tables and shelter available. There is also a stage, so maybe on some days events are organised here, however when we were here it was all quiet.

You can swim in the river but it's quite muddy along the shores

name: Zlatna Dolina
description:
Free camping on the shore of the Cetina river. Close to restaurant "Zlatina Dolina". There's a camping sign, so it's officially allowed. I also asked the owner of the restaurant to verify and it is.

Toilets of the restaurant can be used and you can swim in the clear but cold water of the river

name: Big parking
description: Big parking lot on gravel. Nice beach 5 mins walk

name: Lun Olive Woods
description:
Parking Spot directly by the entrance to the national park. We stood here with a camper for one night and nobody bothered. Very quite, beside some cars driving by.
Entry to the beach trough the park costs 15 kn per person but is totally worth it.

name: Parking Spot by the lake
description:
Parking Spot directly by the lake.
At the morning the spot is used by the visitors for the lake. But during the night it’s very quiet.

name: Fort Punta Christo
description:
we slept in the parking lot next to the road between threes 
quiet spot without view

name: Kopito camping Hvar
description: New campground with pool, kitchen, electric, wifi, etc. 1km walk downhill to Hvar. 30€ for 3 people. Probably the cheapest campground on the island. Friendly owner speaks English, but usually not around the site. Pick any spot and call the # on the sign.

name: Nice beachfront site in a lagoon
description: A nice place inside a lagoon. Has a parking space which is above the beach where you can stay. Lovely to swim and watch the sunset. A few cars passed by during the night. Besides that, it’s quiet. We came with a small van. The road is rocky but it’s doable and worth it!

name: Terrace place
description:
Abandoned place where there is a terrace. All the trees have been removed and there are only pebbles/small rocks. Amazing view over the hills, water and the mainland. Rocky road to come here but worth the drive. 
We came with a small BW-van and it was a good drive. Jeeps can go further down the road to the end near the water.

name: Slavonski Brod
description: Near the river on a small peninsula with Walter, toilets and cold showers.

name: Old Hotel Complex / urban exploring
description: Great urban exploring in this old and completely empty hotel complex. Some nice overnight spots, I stayed on the flat concrete square down from where the bee boxes are. Very private. Several entries, watch out for the holes in the road.

name: Park
description:
You can camp everywhere of this big park's parkinlots.
It's 75kzna for a campervan, can stay as long as you want. (if you leave and come back, you have to do a new payment)
Drinking water, pit toilets, restaurant, bar, everything is in the park. 
You can ask at the kanooclub for filling the campervan watertank. They also have showers there.

name: Camp Peca
description: Sandy pitches with lot’s of trees. When raining it get’s muddy. Facilities look basic but are good, hot water. We were on our own in October, not even the owner was there at night. Bus stop for Dubrovnik around the corner (20min by bus, 15kn pp per ride). Ask owner for the schedule (app 1x per hour). 2 pers, 1 car rtt, €10. Cheap for the area!!

name: Camping Vrila
description:
Free wifi, beer on tap, beachfront. 
Peaceful except for jackals howling at night. 
200 kuns for 3 in a campervan.

name: Luka Dubrava Beach
description: Beachfront parking on gravel with some shade under olive trees. An old abandoned campground is up the road. Peaceful quiet night. No amenities, but good cell service.

name: quiet spot
description: This spot is only for motorhomes, not for tents. We stayed here for a couple of nights in the off  season never had any problems. Great location nice walkways along the water and a beautiful historic town on top of the hill.

name: on the beach
description: This is a great spot right on the water. We stayed here for a couple of nights in the of season without any problems. This place is only for motorhomes no tents. The marina is only across the road with a fuel station for boats and cars where you find water tabs.

name: Quiet overnight spot
description: This is a quiet spot with lots of room suitable for large rigs. Short walk to the center of town with restaurants and coffe shops.

name: Park site Kantrida
description: A big flat open parking place with roughly 200 spots. Located right next to the sea. Often there are other campers found here. At night, you have a beautiful view of the city with all the little lights. It's gorgeous.

name: Money Exchange Danijel
description: Best rate I could find near city centre. 7.37Kn=1€ compared to 7.1Kn=1€ at the yellow exchange both chains around the tourist centre.

name: Makarska free parking
description: It’s a nice parking lot under the trees and next to shore. Nice view during the sunset. We spent a night with no trouble.

name: Large parking in city center
description: Parking free of charge during night from 9 pm to 7 am. Surprisingly quiet. Walking distance to the center / port / restaurants.

name: Camping Arena Stoja
description: Typical huge holiday campground without any flair directly on the ocean  Showers and toilets clean and ok. Staff very friendly and speaks English and German fluently. We paid in off season 18 Euro per night incl. electricity (price only online available). It was quite when we were there but in summer it must be completely full. There is a bus in front of the gate that goes three times an hour to city centre of Pula. Wifi free, fast and available almost everywhere on the spot. Several restaurants on the campground.

name: Wild camping next to the beach
description:
Two to three level spots where you can park with your 4x4 (no big rig). If you don't have a 4x4 or a big rig you can park uphill and walk about 100 meters to the beach where you can put your tent (or sleep uphill in the parking lot). Beautiful view. In the daytime some visitors but in the nighttime very quite. No shade. Dogs are officially not allowed directly at the beach but there where some visitors with dogs and no one cared.
Update: On the second night came a guy (Mario) and told us, that it is private and we could pay 100 Kuna or leave. We paid, because at the end it was cheaper than a campground. And he said we were not allowed to make a campfire.

name: Auto-Camp Pod Maslinom
description:
Nice, family run, campground near Dubrovnik. very clean amenities, hot water, hot showers, places with shadow. A lot of places facing the see on the back side of the campsite, fantastic views. These might be a bit harder to reach with big rigs. The front side has large places, good for a big rig. 

We paid € 14,- a night. 2 person, car with rooftoptent and electricity. (ACSI card member). 

Great place to relax after Dubrovnik. Bus stop in front of the campsite, only 20 minutes to the old town of Dubrovnik.

Check the pictures for prices (April 2019).

name: Small lake
description:
nice place to stay with a lake. if it is rainy muddy road but the site is grass.
4x4 required, not for big rigs. space for a few cars. no cellular connection here

name: Privat Road
description: This is not the official road to the lake. Its closed by a barriere.

name: Closed Road
description: This road is in Private property, offroading here is not alowed anymore.

name: View on Cres
description:
top of a mountain amazing view.
going up here needs a vehicle with good offroad capabilities.

name: Autocamp Draga
description: very nice Campsite, friendly reception, place and ablutions super clean, EUR 20.- for 2 persons with Camper

name: Peter and Barbara Scheltus
description:
Permaculture setup with great space in nature to camp and interact with lovely owners. We paid €28 for two people and a camper van for one night.
Great area and nice place to camp.

name: Podgora
description: Quite place at a memorial. Small steep road to the location.

name: Auto Camp Merinero
description:
Great little campsite literally on the water. 
It's the garden of the house next door which has a WC and Shower.
No mobile coverage.

name: Spot near lake
description:
Nice little spot next to a lake at the end of a dirt road. 
Evening time mosquitoes come out but otherwise nice.

name: Parking Valun
description: Free at this time of the year. Only one other camper here:-) Good for one night. Outdoor showers at the beach (tent) camp. Free wifi at the tourist info in the village (5min) walk.

name: Kamp Slatina
description: Really big campground. Very clean. Dogfriendly. Cheapest place for 185HRK for one night (2+van+dog) :-( Don‘t know if it really fits for overlanders.

name: Kamp Preko Mosta
description: Very nice and idyllic camping. Very friendly owner. Dogfriendly. Wifi next to the toilets. Nice walk at the sea on the right side in the camping (NW). 144HRK for one night. (2+van+dog) Recommended!

name: Kamp Mali
description: Small and nice campground. Dogfriendly. Nice small village. Only a small dog beach :-(. 140HRK per night (2+van+dog). Recommended!

name: Quiet overnight spot on the Danube
description: Quiet overnight spot on the Danube. Stayed here a couple of days without any problems. Great restaurant nearby.

name: Kamp Luka
description: Small and cheap campground. 80HRK/night (2+van+dog). But toilets and showers are ugly:-( We left...

name: Camp Lisičina
description: Nice campground surrounded by rocks. Dog friendly. Simply and clean. 100HRK/night (2+van+dog). Nice walk up to a little village. Recommended.

name: Top of ciste
description: Nice walk to the top of a hill. Amazing view over sea and island. Bring good shoes. Circa 0.75h from Zivogosce Strn.

name: Kamp Paradiso
description: Campground an a hill with all day sun. Nice small beach. To expensive for what it offers. But maybe it will be better after the renovation which is now in progress. 120HRK/night (2+van+dog)

name: Kamp Denka
description: Nice, idyllic and clean campground. Friendly owner. Washing machine 30HRK. 130HRK/night (2+van+dog). Recommended!

name: Kamp Sunce
description: Small and nice campground. Very friendly owner family. Next to the village and beach. 100HRK/night (2+van+dog). We were alone at this time of the year:-)

name: Kamp Adriatic
description: Campground with lot of shady spots. Owner sells olive oil and wine. Everything ok. 90HRK/night (2+van+dog)

name: Val Vidal
description: Croatia's coast line is not known for it's rustic and small camp sites. This camping will definitely surprise you. A small campsite, beautifully situated next to some of the most extreme "camp cities" we have ever seen. Still get the shivers when thinking of it. But this small camping is really something else. Nice pitches, nice views, quiet and lots of space. Downsides? Well, maybe the tiny ablution block, but further nothing to mention. Friendly owners and a good atmosphere!

name: At Borik Beach
description:
Next to the rocky beach in a little forest under pine trees. Dirt road with some places to park with the car. A little bit dirty. Nice view at the sea and the sunset.
Restaurant/Bar at the begining of the dirt road.

name: Camping Selce
description: A small, tidy & clean campsite with 12 places for small to mid size camping vans. Electricity, Water, hot shower, laundry facility. Camp sites appr. 50 m from beach. No through traffic. Quiet place. Stayed here in low season beginning June.

name: Lane End
description: Stunning overnight stop. Area is uneven but there are plenty of stones around to help level. fantastic views of the Croatian coast. Should be accessible to most vans and 4x4.

name: Port 9 Campsite
description: A campsite of medium size located in a bay. Nearby at site there are apartments and mobilhomes for rent. Sanitary facilities are clean. Restaurant and bar at site. You can walk by foot to the  town of Korcula (2,5km) or you can take the boat Taxi (15Kn). We think that the campsite is only suitable for one or two days. We paid 27€ for the first night for two persons, two motorbikes and a small tent.

name: Bear Cave and River Trail
description: Follow hiking trail to the end. Nice and adventurous trail at and in the river. About 50m before the trail ends you can go up a steep and narrow trail (right side) to the national park for free:-) (see foto) Bring bathing suit and good shoes with you!

name: backpackers home
description: Central hostel with safe parking for motorbikes. Close to the beach, store and bakery close by, clean, friendly, great kitchen available. Big common area

name: Fun Hostel
description: Large Hostel nestled on the coast, an easy, flat, ten minute walk from Old Town Rejika. Good, off road, discrete parking for bikes.

name: Dubrovnik Backpackers Club
description: Seems to be a converted apartment complex spread over several floors.  No significant signage outside so it's easy to ride straight by.  There's off road parking, on a quiet street out on the Dubrovnik Peninsular, for a good few bikes, and it felt safe, to me at least.  Rooms are what you'd expect for a hostel.  Bunk beds, ensuite toilet and shower, it was in  my bunkroom at least.  The only minor niggle with the bunks being that the top bunk was too low to maker sitting on the bottom bunk comfortable.  Great facilities in the ground floor communal area and a good kitchen.  Super market near by and easy access to the regular, reliable bus service to take you to old town, where it all seems to happen otherwise it's maybe  an hour's walk.  There's an actual bank (OTP Bank) nearby where I used the ATM without having to pay a fee, one of my pet hates.  There's also a pedestrianised street nearby with the usal assortment of restaurants/cafes.  Prices throughout Dubrovnik seem higher than others in Croatia.  There's a vespa dealer in town (moto Centar Dubrovnik) which has some limited stock of bulbs, oils etc..  The best part of the hostel are the hosts. An elderly couple who are kind, welcoming knowledgable and helpful, interesting and ready to chat.  There is an age limit apparently if you look closley at the hostels T&C's to avoid those looking for something more relaxing to become irritated at those looking to party but to be honest, I'm outside of the upper age limit and didn't have any issues, might be worth checking out, depending what you're after, before checking in.

name: Montenegro/ Croatia Border
description: Two stops. Entering Croatia took some time. Checked passports. Vehicle documents

name: Camp Miočić
description: A hidden champion! Very nice place to stay not only for one night. Moderate prices, payment in € possible, but no payment by card. Directly at the beach. Personnel speak English and German. Clean showers and toilets. Own grill, restaurant with delicious fish and meat dishes.

name: Glavanove
description: Walk down the stairs and you have a perfect place to swim. You could camp there too. There are a lot of people walking by at night but nobody says something. Around 10:00 it gets crowded.

name: Autokamp Punta Povile
description: Waterfront Campsite but that‘s it. Good enough for one night. Toilets are dirty.

name: House Angie
description:
Guesthouse with a few rooms to rent or some space arround for one or two campers. Think the young guy who manages this guesthouse lives there with his parents/grandmother. However, very friendly and helpful. They wanted to serv us breakfast as well. 
He told us that we can park for 10 Euros for one night, we gave him 20.

name: Kamp Bunica V
description: Small camping direct on the sea, situated in a small bay with pebble beach and clear water. We payed for a family of 2 adults and 2 children (9 and 10) and our campervan without electricity E35 per night.

name: Varaždin
description: The owner of this campground has died. This has some advantages. The camping is for free. There is no electricity and no toilets. There is an Austrian guy here where you can get water. You can camp/pitch your tent next to the lake. A great place to go sailing if you bring your own boat. There is not enough wind to go kite surfing or windsurfing however there is a place to start if you bring a para motor. No big rigs, because you have to go under a bridge in order to get here.The entrance is the first right turn after crossing the bridge.

name: Camp Kosirina
description:
Large campsite between olive trees and pine trees, situated along the shore around a blue bay. Great and safe for swimming and hunting for tiny crabs with kids. Beware of the sea urchins. The end is a peninsula where the nudist part is. There is no electricity on the peninsula and you can pick a spot you like. There are no fixed places. The other part of the campsite is half with electricity. Most places are not flat. 2 toilet/shower buildings with decent water, that can be pretty far from a camp spot. 
We were happy we had our bicycles with us. In the morning there’s a small stall with fresh bread. The whole day you can eat some simple snacks and have a drink at one of the two beach shacks. And there’s a tiny shop that sells fruit, vehetables and olive oil. We paid for 2 adults, 2 kids and a campervan 35€ per night. 
Note: Google maps shows this place with a phone number of someone who wants to rent out parking spaces and it is not from the campsite.

name: Trolokve
description: Remote place, 4x4 needed, nice camping ground, close to single empty house at the beach.

name: Das Fledermaushotel
description: Small familiar campsite directly at the lake. Linked to a well running Restaurant with delicious food. Cheap price. About 100 kn per night. Quiet and calm.

name: Hrušcica
description: Place next to the river (Save). Nice view.

name: Split
description: This is really a remote place where you can swim and even park overnight, right by the sea. But for brave drivers - last 300 m is a narrow path with the bushes, but we made it with our Matilda 2m wide Hymer. It is in the industrial part, a little bit dirty but clean water and historical town on sight. It is quite calm here.

name: Marián
description: This is  great place for wild campers with romantic views of the sea in the company of cactuses and cicadas. The entrance to the sea is a little bit difficult but possible. The parking lot is dirty with rubbish, but the rocks and the sea compensate for it. We spent a beautiful day here with only a few visitors starting late afternoon.

name: Beatiful Bay
description:
Beautiful bay site near to the port of Sućuraj. Small parking area and a lot of space to set up a tent. Some people come to swim during the day time but in the evening it‘s quite and even more lovely. One night another Camper came by but other than that we were alone. We easy stayed two nights sleeping in a tent. 
We came with a 4x4, small Vans (such as VW T6) should fit too. Don‘t know about big camping Cars because of some narrow parts of the road.

name: Kamp Grebišće
description:
Nice camping site close to the sea and the city Jelsa. The owners and staff are very friendly and the facilities are being cleaned several times during the day and are in a really good condition. A lot of places in the shadow. You could even rent a small bungalow. It’s 205 kn a night for 2 adults a car and a tent. 
They also have an own beach and free Wifi.

name: Lakeside
description: This is a very nice place right at the lake. You have a nice view of the lake and can go for a swim. It probably is possible to get here with smaller motorhomes, too. This seems to be private ground but there is no house and we had no problems.

name: Bushes
description:
This would be a gem if it wasn't for the trash and toilet paper lying around abundantly. I hope you don't add any to it.
Small area, slightly inclined, among the bushes or forest, not visible from the highway or any building. It's up a small paved road that soon after becomes overgrown with bushes. I think it leads up to a big military area. Nobody passed during my stay and I had a very quiet night under a sky full of stars.
Free, no services.

name: Korenica
description: on a field with sheep.  View on hills.  Good gravel road for access.

name: Village
description: Drinking water and repair station for bicycles.

name: Gornja Bucica
description: A pleasure to stay at the foot of a bell. Quiet place in the village.

name: Stonehenge Camping
description:
Campsite has a rocky ground. Lots of mosquitos when we stayed.
Nice view.

LEAVE ONLY FOOTPRINTS!

name: Small Bay
description: Small bay with a few options to park your vehicle. Not suitable for big rigs. Directly at the beach with some shady spots. The beach is sadly full of plastic trash so make sure to pick some up before you leave.

name: AUTO CAMP AGAVA
description: The cheapest campsite that we could find in Dubrovnik. The place is nice and clean. 2 minutes walking from Sheraton beach which is very nice. Bus 10 to go to Dubrovnik station and Old Town. Very close to a small mall with market. We paid 112 kunas (around 15 euros) for 2 people + small tent

name: Plivitce Palace
description: Right near the road that goes to the National Park, this 4* hotel has nice accommodations with a very pleasant restaurant down below.

name: Kumrevec
description:
Flat area near village no traffic at night clean and quiet
sur une surface asphaltée propre pas de trafic la nuit a 100 m du village

name: Purga stadium
description:
grass and gravel near soccer field quiet

mi herbe mi parking a côté du stade calme après le match
grass and gravel near soccer field quiet

name: Forest Clearing
description: Nothing to write home about, but: a quiet clearing in the forest, underneath a newly constructed power line (didn't feel any effect, not high current). It's quiet, you are invisible from any road or building, fresh air. No installations, free. Nobody came past. Just 2km from the motorway exit. Access via good dirt road. Nice!

name: Autocamp
description: Very basic campground run by Maria who speaks some German and does not speak English. It is directly on the sea with a public beach and cafe with pizzas. Nice views from the campsite. Electric, hot showers and washing machine available. Campground run down with garbage in the bushes, broken chairs which can be still used by guests. Lots of shade available. No WiFi but WiFi available at the cafe separate from the campground. 200 kn per night per 2 people and camper with electric.

name: Danica
description:
Really nice and clean hostel. The owner Stefani is a really friendly lady who knows the needs of motorcyclists. - Beer and breakfast.
We paid 40€ for a double bed room including breakfast with air-condition.
3 parking places behind the house also for campers. Motorcycles can be parked on the property.
Laundry service is possible.
Supermarkt and gas station within walking distance. Beach is around 200m away across the main road.
Extremely clear water! Incredible!

name: Behind the Pines
description:
Beautiful wild camping spot for 4 wheel drive rigs and lifted campervans.
Epic sunset and staying overnight directly at the ocean.
Possible parking down by the sea and even a good spot for swimming.

To get here you must follow a small gravel road till you pass a small pine forest. Directly left behind the pines starts the small trail wich ends by the sea.
Small rocks and muddy road condition, but easy to pass by a 4x4.

name: Mlini
description: This is a small privately run campground for tents and campers. The showers and toilets are clean. Washing machine also available. Lots of shade is provided by trees.  Across the busy street is a shopping center with DM, grocery store etc. Some campers may hear the traffic on the street. Walk to the beach. WiFi included. 2 people and camper with electricity is 50+50+70= 170 kn for the high season which ends on September 10th. Bus takes you into town for 18 kn each way or take a boat for 100 kn return.

name: Camping by the River
description:
Saw a few shelters and benches with quite a few mobile homes parking next to them. Ask the locals if I could camp there with a tent. The answer was positive. Seems nobody cared. 

The lakeshore was a bit muddy. It's okay to swim though. Quite some fishers.

name: careless whispers
description: Quiet scenic beach, hidden behind a long rocky road and bushes. There aren't any houses nearby. We arrived here around 6pm and only one other couple were still swimming. After they left, we made food and had a couple of drinks. Afterwards we slept on the beach in the beautiful moonlight. No one interrupted us, cars can't see you from up the hill. Don't go down the small rocky road by car, but park just at the beginning of the little road. There is place for 2-3 cars. 100% would do it again.

name: Forrest Campsite
description: A wonderful campsite in the forest. A great place for one or more nights.

name: staništa
description: excellent place to camp,beautiful view, beware of wild animals

name: Kôsljun
description: Very nice location for wildcamp. 30 meters from stoney sea side and shallow waters, beautiful for swim. One house nearby but for the rest very quiet with some trees and bush to hide for strong september winds.. road is on about 70 meters with bush between, but sometimes cars pas by heading to village Povljana. Lots of opportunities to put your car. Even near water, but peobably locals use this stoney beach to in summer time weekends.

name: Jaron Lake Park
description: Camp in parking lot, next to lake. Cost 150kn. Toilets in various places. Outdoor shower next to beach. Walk to outdoor bars. Nice place.

name: Camping Labadusa
description: I had a really hard time finding a spot to wild camp with a tent along the rocky coastline so went to look for an affordable campsite. Paid just over €12,- (91 HRK) for one person, tent and motorcycle. Suitable for any kind of transport and accommodation you have and a nice location at a good beach for swimming. Might be a bit busy during the day and in peak season but it's a comfortable place to stay with good amenities, WiFi, a restaurant next door and a baker that comes by in the morning. Don't know why, but there's no electricity between 10 pm and 7 am.

name: Nice field, good view
description: Convenient spot on the way to or from Slovenia. The track that gets you here is on maps.me. Definitely 4x4 or motorcycle and not accessible for big rigs since the track is too narrow. Not really fast from the road so you'll here some of it. There's a military base close by. Talked to the guard and told him I was going to camp in the hills and he did not tell me that I couldn't. Lots of wildlife around. Wild goats, horses and cows so if you don't like the sounds they make you'd better not go here.

name: Krka River Crossing
description: This bridge going over the Krka River has a width restriction of 2.2m.

name: Little harbour
description: This place is situated on a small harbour in a dead end, right in front of a campsite. This one was closed mid-october. I stayed here one night and didn't see anybody. The place is quiet, for once no barking dogs, you can still hear the road but not too loud. Nice view and sunset. It must be pleasant to stay in this little campsite during opening season as well.To get there follow the Camping Prosika sign from main road.

name: free camp vivi
description:
Free Camp Vivi in ​​a field at an individual at 30-40 minutes from the lake of plivitce (max 3m height). Stayed here for one night. 6 other vans where staying as well. The owner is very nice and friendly. The owner speaks a little bit English and is learning it every day more and more. Do not hesitate to give her a little help (DIY, purchase of honey or pancakes among others), 
she has the project to create sustainable facilities sanitary types, terrace with tables to eat and all improvements allowing travelers to be well settled. No electricity and no water point, the village is not connected (the water comes from a well), it should be installed in 2019.

name: Ranc Ramarin
description:
Restaurant, Horse Ranch, Camping.
Got 8 Camping spots with water and power. Next to water. Away from Road.

name: E17 Autoservis
description: Very helpful garage/mechanic, mechanic/owner is native English speaker. They are also contactable through facebook

name: Kva Hostel
description:
The location really can't be beaten. It's right on the river walk and near all the bars and restaurants. The entrance has double doors and the owner was happy to let me park the motorcycle inside the building for the night - a rarity for Europe! 

fast WiFi, nice common area, good kitchen.

dorm was €13/night

name: youth hostel
description:
There aren't too many affordable options in this town outside of this place. €24 for dorm. €34 for private single.

no dedicated looking but I left my Moto out front of the sidewalk and chained it to a barrier with no issues.

only complaint is that both breakfast end e and checkout happens by 9am.

name: Free tap fresh water
description: With standard threads for hose. Some garbage bins next to it. head to the top of the gravel road for a picnic spot and fire pitt that you can camp overnight.

name: Free Parking Lot
description: It’s a free parking place almost at the copacabana beach, plenty space for big rigs, We park our Motorhome of 6,5 meters and stay for two nights in low season, maybe in higher seasons they don’t let park, I don’t know

name: Hostel 4 you
description: new hostel with private parking ($5) in a dental clinic building. a bit weird but super clean and big balcony to enjoy the sunset.

name: guesthouse Isabel la catolica
description:
nice cozy familiar hostel. facilities are so so but the host and the atmosphere make up for it. parking for one motorcycle only. 
free apples, bananas, tea, coffee, milk, bread, pasta, noodles and....even Laundry! 
cheap during winter. but dubrovnik could be expensive in summer i am sure.

name: old airplane
description:
Parking lot with old military airplane. It's just there man. Crazy. It's an old 50 or 60s airplane and you can climb over it and all. There is also a deserted airbase nearby but there was police when I passed by and you can't be there. At the parking lot where the old airplane is it is fine with you can stay at night is my experience. Police came came at tonight and checked my passport but they were very friendly. I think they look for immigrants.more than anything elso
This place is 🤟🏻

name: Hunter spot
description: A gravel road on river side leads into both directions. We stayed on the left side next to a hunting spot. Very idyllic, only some noise from the road far away.

name: dog beach
description: Gravel parking with greatviews over the bay and the bridge. Next to the water above a small harbour. I stayed here for a night and also in daytime and heard from several locals that it is no problem to park here out of season.

name: Eco Gecko‘s Mini Autocamp
description:
Small and family owned camp ground in the large garden of the owner.
The street to the camp is a little narrow, this is why Big Rigs probably not fit.

name: Mini-Camping Marko
description: Nice small camp ground with good facilities. We payed 130 Kuna (~18€) per Night for two persons and a camper.

name: LPG kamp gas fill statino
description:
Refill Station for Propan/Butan. All type of bottles are accepted, no own adapter is needed. Friendly, fast, cheap!!
Address: Ul. Hrvatskog Sabora 8a, 23000, Zadar, Croatia

name: Camping Amines Sirena
description: Big Campground with shady pitches below big trees an a few of luxury pitches directly at the water. Price depents on the type of pitch you take. Starts from 20€ up to 70€ in high season.

name: Camp Korana
description: Owner driven spot, along the Korana River... 20€/night (2 adults, 1 Toyota Landcruiser). You can use 2 canoes to take a ride to a small water fall (distance approx 1000m). Area is big, so it is quiet at night.

name: Trokascan
description: Park with shadow next to the entrance of the castle. Quiete. Unpaved but flat.

name: Vrata Velebita
description: Natural Campground in the Velebit Mountains abt. 400m above sea level. Take care the road is steep, small and very curvy, not for big rigs, 4WD not necessary. Place is partly shaded, very quiet, clean toilets and hot showers, washing mashine available. There is one column for electricity (×4). The owner may invite you to visit his small museum and offer some special grappa. Good ground for tents, bikers are wellcome.

name: Road 8
description: Adria Oil gas station; free water tap next to the tire pressure pump at the back of the station.

name: Marsh land with yellow flowers
description: You take a dirt road in, get over the dam/hill - then drive a bit. Then you come to a big open marsh land, we camped under a big tree, view open Field for 1,8km in two direction. Yellow flowers as fare the eye can see. View to herd of cows and horses. Talked to the farmer, a friendly guy, surprised to see someone camp here. 4wd only. Area not good in winter time, it gets floded.

name: Pine Wood on the sea
description: A Beautiful Place under Trees with direkt connection to the sea. Some people showed up at 11pm but we have no roblem to stay there 2 nights.

name: beautiful wildcamp next to sea
description:
At the end of a dirt road going nowhere. Next to the sea, just a short walk of 2min. No beach, but easy rocks for swimming.
No 4x4 needed, normal car will do, but some brush in the middle of the road and bit Rocky, so maybe not so nice for your precious brand new ride ;)
Road was not on Maps.me or Google, but not hard to find

name: Sutivan Avtocamp
description: Nice little camp, room for about 5 vans and some more tents. Maybe a bigger RV but I would call 1st (the turn at the bottom of the hill into town is tight). We camped under a fig tree with our motos and had figs everyday (mid August). There is a small kitchen with fridge, stove, sink and some cook ware. Bathrooms are clean and communal. Wifi works at the front door of the house (they have apartments too), the beach is 1min walk, town is 10min. Nice base to explore the island, I looked at the camps around Bol and they were packed. We paid 120kn per night for 1 tent, 2 people.

name: Right next to great pebble beach
description:
At the end of a gravel track, next to a beautiful pebble beach, small spot for one car. 
Need to arrive quite late as there will be people on the beach (and there was a car parked on the spot) until 21ish. This was mid high season.
5 minute walk to a busier beach, with cool drinks, toilets, and snacks. 
Normal car is OK, bigger vans will struggle with the tight bends and turnaround.

name: Lika Camping
description: Nice little place with 20 spots, water/electric available. There are some trees but not a huge amount of shade but even with an RV you can make it work. We put the motos & tent right under the trees in the grass. Toilets/showers are brand new and clean. There is a washing machine, sinks for dishes and a pool if you want to swim. RV dump station and the RV toilet thing. The owner is super nice, speaks English & some German. We paid 160kn for 2 people/1 tent. It's simple but pleasant, we were the only ones here and there is a Tommy supermarket in town if you need stuff. Good stop for a night (better than paying 30€ an hour north at Plitvice).

name: Kamping Romantik
description: Nice place, but no shade (trees are tiny) and expensive. We paid 29€ for 1 night, 2 people, 1 tent, 2 motos, no electricity. There is a nice pool, bathrooms, fridge, wifi, and sinks for dishes but it's too expensive.

name: Karinovo
description: Refuelling gaz for our seiss bottle. Nice people.

name: Villa Mare&Filip
description: Great place for morcycle trips. Very close distance to Dubrovnik. Only 11km. Sea and a small beach just in front of apartment.  Very friendly owner. Safe parking for motorcycle. Super clean.  100% recommendation.

name: Kamp Tunarica
description: Family with 3 small kids, a lot of shade but hard to find even ground for  tents. We were not happy with the beach  and water was not totally clean. The camp is in the nature and the toilets are new and clean. It was fine, but could be better.

name: Linden Tree Retreat Center
description:
True Resort

Linden Tree Retreat & Ranch is a small, privately-owned and operated eco-safari-style resort, open seasonally to guests from all over the world

name: Off Season Beach
description:
Beautiful beach with parking!I have been here in April when it was still a little chilly. So the beach was completely empty and I have dared to stay for a 
 night. There are no signs that camping is forbidden here but I could imagine that it’s not so easy in season here.

name: End of island
description: Beautiful place, at end of gravel road. Very clean, no visitors at night.

name: Trgovina Pontem
description: Small refreshment stand with awning: coffee, beer, soft drinks, wifi, toilet, tap water for cleaning,electricity

name: Near Bus Stop
description:
Maybe 30 yards down a gravel road (which starts at the southern edge of the bus shelter), there are 2 to 3 secluded spots to spend the night. Bring your own food and water.

There may be a bit of noise from the main roadway. Then, again, it may not bother you.

name: South of Zagreb
description: knool in large field about 70 meters behind caffe/bar. Gravel road leads to camping site.

name: Parking Area
description:
Small free Parksite

10min to Basilika and Old City of Porec
Parked here 4h no problems

name: Old clay pigeon shooting site
description:
This is a old clay pigeon shooting site but no more in use. 

Through a small street which is around 100m from a side street you reach this perfect site via a gravel track. 

We stayed overnight and had no issues. 
No cars passed us. You can not see this place from the street. There is a lot of space to stay 4-6 caravans. 

Sometimes you can hear a car from the street 100m away but not often. 

We stayed here from 10.05.21 overnight. 
I wormly recommend you this great site. You are alone here. 

Check the Pictures!

name: Near the bees
description: Small meadow maybe good for camping with tent

name: Cres Harbour
description:
Small Parking site
10 kn/ hour

1-24h possible

name: gravel parking site
description:
Free parking side
gravel

0,8 - 1km to the center.

name: Bor Campsite
description:
Perfect for big rigs  9m and longer.
Near the old town and Harbour

name: Spot next to the river
description: Nice spot at the end of the road. Next to the river, follow the gravel road. The previous spot close by was occupied. We’ve stayed for a night, no one bothered us.

name: Camp Pineta
description: Small quiet campsite, highly recommended for individual campers.

name: Sava River bank/Croatia side
description: Camping between (and below) river levee bike/walk path (nicely lit at night) and river—width varies 10 to 40m (most of width leveled) with grassy plants , steep drop to water so river access limited. Although more than 1 km of dirt road access available on both sides of the town, the south has trees for shade in the afternoon, but access path is rutted and may be a problem when wet. We asked at police outpost on riverbank about restrictions—free for anyone to camp, awesome!! No trash around wooded part. Wouldn’t advise big rigs.

name: ruined memorial
description:
Really quiet and lovely spot under the shaded pines.Not sure what this place was but it made a perfect quiet night camp.
Say Memorial on Maps.me.
1.5 km off the road and 5 km to Lldl.
Follow the road around the bend.
There's also an adjacent field of pines which is where I camped.
Nobody passed by.

name: Top of the hill
description:
Only for 2 wheels (van cannot enter)!

On the top of the hill, here you can put your tent with an amazing view of the bridge and river. 

No noise. It can be bit windy in the morning.

name: St. George
description: Great place to stop on the way to have a cheap coffee with nice view and shadow.

name: Water
description:
No potable water nur good for wash.
Big and nice Place

name: Nice beach parking
description:
Moderator Note: Please do not try to avoid fees by arriving late at camping places.
.....
Lots of space for campers and cars. Close to the beach.
5 euros to park between 7:00-21:00.

name: Coin Laundry
description: Coin laundry and car wash - free electricity, water, WiFi . Great place to wash. 25kuna for 5kilo. We could refill our water tanks for free

name: Free parking, Lot of space
description: Free parking near center! Also near supermarket

name: Drinking water from the mountain
description: Great free drinking water from the mountain. Ice cold 24/7. Best water quality, all locals come here to get their water !

name: Spot off main road
description:
A dirt road passable by normal car, then parking just off the side road in the meadows, protected from view, for an overnight stay. About a km towards the national park there is an OK restaurant Pensian Winnetou (not a joke) with reasonable food ar reasonable price. 
I didn't stay though, as some very territorial insects (I know!) kept attacking my car (I know!!) and I went a bit closer to the road, to another spot on the side of the road. 
No more aggressive insects, but an owl flying by (I know!!!).

name: Terra farm
description:
NOT POSSIBLE TO CAMP/TENT

Ranch Terra is a family ranch located in the small village of Irinovac, only 8km from Plitvice Lakes National Park. On our ranch we have a land of 10ha on which you can enjoy the beautiful green surroundings, breathtaking mountain views, and company of our horses. They offer trail riding along the natural trails of the spectacular Croatian landscape.
Relax during your visit or riding and enjoy our warm and professional service, friendly, happy, and well-trained horses.
Estimated price: 15€
You also can pay an extra 10€ for one hour of toilet and shower.

name: sabljaci kamp
description: nice small and quiet campground, friendly staff, hot showers clean bathroom,fast wifi,around 23€

name: Katarina
description: Excellent and cheap restaurant with easy parking. Tables under the trees for shade. Very good for a lunch break. Owner is extremely friendly

name: Roadside but spacious
description: Just a Roadside spot, spacious, and quiet because of little traffic on the road. Bad cell reception. Easy access, close to the Ucka Nature Reserve installations.

name: Robinson Accommodation Freedom
description:
A very simple, quiet and nature camping place in the middle of Istria. A small kitchen, a fireplace and solar energy for shower and electricity are available. Perfect if you want to avoid huge camping from the coast.
Seasonal closed end of October.

name: Hostel Bureau
description:
I didn’t stay here but i can say there is a big private parking in front of this hostel where probably you can park your vehicle 
And the location is great!

name: HI hostel
description:
Please try to avoid this hostel!!

No A/C (so during summer it’s like a sauna). Rooms incredible tiny. NO kitchen. No a single place to socialise. Ugly toilets. 
Plus, extra price you have to pay this “HI card”…

CHOOSE ANOTHER PLACE PLEASE! 

I just add this place just because you can park your vehicle inside the backyard. The only positive point (but there are other hostel with backyards)

name: Picnic spot
description:
Another nice picnic spot for 2 caravans. There is even a uncomfortable concrete table. More covered by wind from the close one. And maybe bit better for tents 
Ciao

name: Mini Camping
description:
After a long jurney we found this very nice place. They also have some apartments. Its very tiny and built in the rocks. Maybe not for everyone, but we liked it. There is hot shower, whater, and a fridge. 
The city is 5 minutes by foot. The beach is near. Also a minni beach bar. 
It says the water is drinkable, but it taste like clore.

name: beach plavina
description: Nice place next to the beach, very quiet at night, you can sleep here.

name: Restaurant Gastro Lika
description: Very good Grill, Restaurant, friendly service!

name: riverside wild camping
description: Idyllic little camping spot right on the riverbank, secluded from any views due to the thick vegetation. Perfect for swimming and fishing. Easy access for all types of vehicles.

name: Camp Fortuna
description: Nice camp for overnight stay. Plenty of place for tents.RV parkings are spacious.Clean toilets with shower.Dogs are welcome.

name: Camping Bačinska jezera
description: Nice camp near lake. Dogs are welcome,plenty of shade, access to the water is very easy.

name: Lic drinking water
description: Drinking water place, good water, fountainn in a village lic.

name: Free shower
description: Free public shower and toilet next to a small free parking lot. No trailers allowed. Little bay near by to have a swim.

name: Near beach
description:
Quiet place , view on the clear water and near beach ! Only 3 places for small vans ( i have sprinter 4x4 ) 

Enjoy

name: Coastcamping
description:
This Place has a beautiful view on the bay.
A few lots are available.
The way to here is a bit rough but no 4x4 (when it’s dry) needed. 
Don’t be afraid when you read  'military object‘, drive ahead and turn right, you will only pass the fence.

name: Apartman Ana
description: Nice guesthouse owned by a friendly and welcoming family in a small village. I stopped here after crashing my motorbike on a trail in the mountains nearby. The owners helped me find a welder in the village who was able to fix my bike and get me back on the road the next day. I had a small studio with two beds and kitchenette for 35 euro per night.

name: Camp Rogac
description:
Well-maintained campsite directly at the waterfront. Very nice and friendly owner, many longterm campers but also space for shortterm visitors. Several terraces for camping, beautiful garden, good & clean showers and toilets. Roofed sitting area, fire oven.
Cheap, just 5€ per person in tents

name: Camping Vucine
description:
Beautifully located and established campground in the hills with many terraces to camp on, several sea access points. We met a few other bike travelers here.

Good and clean facilities

name: Last escape
description:
Ok… First of all. I think the whole north western part of Croatia is not really made for overlanders. Today I was searching quite some time to find a place before I head towards the border tomorrow. The area is filled with Hotels, Resorts, Golf Clubs, Amusement Parks etc… and all roads to the coast are blocked or private property. Lots of traffic all over. So my recommendation is to just stay away from here and for motorbikes don’t think about riding the coast streets down to Pula. Was no fun at all… Estern part is Ok though!

But - this being said. Here you can at least cover the night in peace. Road only 4x4.

name: Roadside
description: Just next to a lonely road there is space for one car. Easy access over gravel road, should be done with all rigs. Little bit of trash, like everywhere.

name: Biokovo
description: Hill top camp (small) with good 360 views. Open 1/5, close 31/10. 16 June to 30 Sept, 12.50 euro/person. Other days, 9 euro/person. Motorcycle/bicycle + tent cheaper. Cash only, euro/Kn. Electricity and full kitchen + fridge included. V clean ablutions. V friendly, complimentary homemade wine on arrival, nice. Located near expressway but not bothersome, also near entrance to tunnel through mountain, 12 min. to coast. Supermarket 10 min. walk in town. WiFi mainly near common area, spotty at sites. Recommended.

name: Restaurant Butina parking lot
description:
You can stay overnight for free in the garden of a quaint restaurant. Please, ask the very friendly owners. They offer very tasty food. It's not expensive.
Nearby is a brownbear refugium worth to visit.
Very recommended place!

name: Parking close to the center of Dakovo
description: Free parking, no facilitys, but 10 min walk to the cathedrale St. Peter

name: Podaca camping
description: Very scenic terraced campground small with 20 sites ,tent area as well clean showers and toilet electricity and water at all so sites. Open until end of olive harvest 12/11 very friendly owners. Charged 100 kuna off season  2 people /camper van great for small rigs. Easy access to beach with promenade and restaurant’s,good swimming beach.

name: Drežnik Grad
description: There is place for fire, table with bench. Hidden nice place for tent.

name: Wodenca Camp
description:
Very nice small camping next to the sea among olive trees, with electricity, good (and clean) bathroom/toilets. Both for tents and camping cars.
Better book in advance by mail during high season. The owners speak english.

https://www.wodenca.com/

name: Paid Parking also for campers
description: Parking close to old town. Also fits big rigs. Price per 24 hours 180 kn

name: Vito’s Place
description:
A very nice home stay camping experience in Zadar.  Vito is a kind and welcoming host and charges 10€/night.   
There’s 2-3 parking spots behind his house, with electricity, water hose, and place to dump cassette toilets.  He is also putting in a washing machine soon.   
The neighborhood is perfect; 100m to pizza, 150m to bakery, 150m to small market, 10 minute walk to a super market, 25 minute walk to tourist district, 10 minute walk to community swimming pool and 5 minute walk to an AMAZING MIND BLOWING AUTHENTIC AFFORDABLE hidden restaurant (UGOSTITELJSKI OBRT K MARIJANU, VL. DARKO SURAĆ).  
For the approach take the easy main streets, don’t let Google lead you through the small windy narrow streets of the neighborhood.

name: Camp Terre
description: Small camping near wine farm.  Gravel pitches some shady places.  One small ablution block.  Clean. Friendly owner.  WiFi not ok for IOS devices.

name: bura
description:
Hi guys, this is a parking with nice view and perfect to have sun.
We sleep here one night with 2 others camper van and no problem, just no park the car on the "asphalte" because the bus turn back at this place. park only on grass.

name: Armenian hotel
description:
Hello, we sleep one night here ( 13/01/22) and no problem.
perfect view for the sunset, sea,sun and mountains! 
For Urbex lovers, you have a big big playground!!

name: Silent view
description:
You need to drive a small Road (59148). The street is small, with some places to overtake. 
Place is a parking space in a curve. 4 Cars in 12+ hours passing by, no one bothered us. Quiet by night, great sunset.

name: Islands
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

on the hill next to the radio station. Perfect view on the islands.
perfect to stay for 1 night or for lunch.
How many islands can you count?

name: Zadar
description: Gas station. Gasoline and fresh water. (Water near to air.)

name: Marina Punat
description:
Hi everybody, we go at this place for wash clothes and shower is free during winter. 115 Kuna for 2 wash machine and one dry machine ( work well), 80 Kuna for 4 hours parking inside. 
It's a good place but you can't sleep here.

name: water
description: Water at gasoline station, just ask if you can fill :)

name: chapel on the hill
description: If you follow the coordinates, you drive through Srinjine and afterwards a small street. After that street it's a farm track with many small hills. You need at least 40 cm heigh underneath your car! ( was possible with mercedes Sprinter) If you manage the first 4 hills, the others are easy. You got a beautiful view, silence and an old chapel :)

name: school parking
description: Just on the left side of the school, you have a small road and a good parking. we sleep here one night (19/01/22), very quite and no problem.

name: fountain
description: in the middle of the street a small fountain with drinking water

name: Camping Cikat
description:
Established Campground. Spots next to the sea, Wi-Fi, toilets, hot showers … all you need
Open 365 days. Perfect for winter camping.

name: in the bush
description: nice hidden place close to the main road

name: Brac sutivan beach
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

good parking at 10 minutes to Supetar, very quiet, sea and mountains view!

name: Petroca Gora Monument
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: camping is illegal here.  Day Use Only,

World War II monument built on Veliki Petrovac, the highest peak of Petrova Gora (Peter's Mountain)

The monument celebrates the uprising and resistance movement of the people of Kordun and Banija against Nazi fascism and commemorates the victims of Nazism, both civilian victims and fallen resistance fighters.

name: Rastoke: little waterfalls,
description: small town with wonderfull little waterfalls. Good place for pictures.

name: between trees
description: small clearing just along the way, exposed to the looks but no passage in the evening. Quiet, correct place to troubleshoot

name: close the river
description:
several spots for vehicules and tent, but the access road can be difficult for Big vehicule because it shakes.

we hear the sound of the city but it's a quiet place. nobody came

name: Predator Ridge
description: Secluded area at the bottom of a dead end road. There is a pebble beach for swimming and great ocean view. We saw many different large birds (hence the chosen name) eagle owls, and hawks etc. The road in is steep and lots of loose rocks and gravel, may not be great for large campers. There is some fenced infrastructure at the very end of the road, see pics.

name: Žedno - Water Tap
description: Small park across from the church in Žedno with a drinking water tap. There is also an open wifi connection :)

name: pine forest close the road
description:
really beautiful place just below the road but you can be out of sight.

it's like the mountain forest. Just be careful with the road Access, can be muddy and  slippery.

name: Lizard Lane
description: Quiet spot at the end of a dead end road. Great sea view, and secluded. The ground is a little rocky, like everywhere else in the area, but we were able to clear a spot for the tent. There is a bar at the entrance to this side road with a height limit, maybe 2.3 meters? No problem to pass with motorcycle or small car.

name: Ferry to Trogir
description: The bridge is currently under construction and out of service. This is where you catch the free ferry across to Trogir. (March 2022)

name: field close the gravel road
description:
Big open field close the gravel road.
near the other spot that i did'nt success to find it.
here Big place to camp, the neighbour passed front some times but didn't stop.

name: clearing forest front the sea
description:
middle clearing among trees, Space for some tents and vehicules. There is a fire Pit with a bench.

Some locals cars passed but nobody in the evening.

Perfect place.

name: Water Tap
description: We checked with a local that this is drinkable water. Tap on the side of the road.

name: Whiskey Rock
description: A spot just off the road, tucked behind a big rock. Beautiful countryside. This is along the TET for any motorcyclists riding it. We didn’t see anyone. Pretty rough road in parts, and if it’s been rainy it’d get pretty muddy. Doable I think with a 4x4 if you are adventurous.

name: Punta Jerta
description: Wonderful small campground with lovely owners. One of the best established campgrounds I have seen in Croatia.

name: Pet Centar - Huge Pet Store
description: Very well stocked pet shop on the outskirts of town. Huge parking area also for big rigs. Pet food and accessories plus medical assistance for cats, dogs, etc.

name: Saricevi Dvori
description: Restaurant located in old stone houses. They prepare homemade dishes and are very cordial and accommodating. Down the road to the sea they have arranged several camping places where you can park for free. They have a beautiful terrace overlooking the beautiful sunset.

name: Saricevi Dvori 1
description: This FREE camping spot is created by Saricevi Dvori. There is a traditional restaurant located nearby ( www.saricevi-dvori.net telephone: 0981743334). Visiting the restaurant is optional, but we would appreciate if you visit us. In the morning you can use toilet ant the bathroom by appointment. There is also free internet in the restaurant area.

name: Wood Chip Way
description: There are lots of trails around this area, and a motocross track nearby which you can hear from this spot. Plenty of camping options in the hills, just pick a road. This little offshoot might be tight for a big rig. The road runs from a church through the forest and exits back onto a paved road. We set up camp in an area where it looks like the locals come and chop wood. There is water at the church. A local came by in his tractor in the morning but seemed indifferent to our presence.

name: Water Tap
description: Potable Water tap at church around side of small building beside the church.

name: Seaside
